column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Diy_coref|

#Text=[0001] The present invention relates to a method and apparatus for fracturing a subterranean formation, and more particularly, to a low cost method and apparatus for fracturing a subterranean formation with a sand suspension.
#Text=[0002] The ordinary flow of hydrocarbons into a well may not be rapid enough to make a drilling operation commercially viable.
#Text=Therefore, stimulating a subterranean formation can be helpful and necessary to facilitate the conductivity of hydrocarbons through a subterranean formation and into a drilled wellbore or hole.
#Text=One means of stimulating hydrocarbon flow is through fracturing a subterranean formation.
#Text=[0003] A number of solutions have been proposed to fracture a subterranean formation.

#Text=One solution proposes using dry sand that is either dumped from a truck or transferred from a storage device via a conveyor belt into a mixing device where it is mixed with a fracture fluid and liquid additives.
#Text=The mixing device then discharges the mixture of sand and fracture fluid into one or more pumps that transfer the fluid downhole.
#Text=This solution, however, can be very resource intensive as the sand, fracture fluid, and liquid additives require their own storage devices and pumps.
#Text=In addition, a separate blending device is required to combine the sand and fluids.
#Text=In some embodiments, this solution can require up to twenty-seven large pieces of equipment.
#Text=This solution is also sometimes unable to maintain consistency in the composition of the fracture fluid.
#Text=The composition can therefore be highly variable and can lead to unpredictable fracturing results.

#Text=[0004] Another solution for fracturing a subterranean formation uses a mixture of sand and fluid contained in a storage device that is constantly agitated to keep the sand suspended in the fluid.
#Text=The storage device discharges the agitated mixture into a blending device where it can be blended with liquid additives and other fluids, which themselves require storage devices.
#Text=The blending device outputs the sand fluid into one or more pumps that transfer the fluid downhole to accomplish fracturing the subterranean formation.
#Text=This solution, however, is also resource intensive and requires an extremely expensive and complex piece of equipment in the agitating storage device.
#Text=This solution may also not maintain consistency in the composition of the fracture fluid and can therefore lead to unpredictable fracturing results.
#Text=[0005] The present invention provides a method and apparatus for fracturing a subterranean formation, which meet the needs described above and overcome the deficiencies of the prior art.
